clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Immunoglobulins (IgG) in a Long-term Non-interventional Study
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Uncontrolled, Non-interventional Observational Cohort Outcome Study of Immunoglobulins in 3 Indications: Primary and Secondary Immunodeficiencies and Neurological Auto-immune Diseases

brief_summary.textblock:
This non-interventional, epidemiological study assesses long-term outcomes in subjects receiving immunoglobulins (IgG) for any treatment purpose, irrespective of the regimen prescribed by the treating physician, under routine clinical conditions in Germany.
Long-term outcome data are collected on patient characteristics in the various indications, drug utilization of intravenous and subcutaneous IgG (e.g. treatment and dosing patterns), effectiveness (i.e. number of infections), tolerability, health related quality of life, and economic variables (number of hospitalizations, sick-leave days etc.) with the possibility to estimate direct costs.

detailed_description.textblock: In view of the broad range of indications in immunodeficiency and immunomodulation, it is of interest to document the use of IgG under the conditions of everyday practice and to analyze the endpoints (outcomes). A prospective cohort study such as this is an important evidence source for such rare diseases as those mentioned above. The aim of this outcome study is to fill the gap of the lack of long-term data in these rare diseases treated with IgG.

primary_outcome.description: Dosage of immunoglobulins (IgG); frequency of IgG administrations; days of treatment with IgG; duration of infusion of IgG.

secondary_outcome.description: For immunodeficiencies (primary PID and secondary SID): frequency of infections; degree of severity of infections (SBIs); duration of antibiotic treatment; necessity of antibiotic treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neurological and muscular function (for neurological auto-immune diseases only)
secondary_outcome.description: Grip strength (dynamometer) Electrophysiology (EMG, ENG); Inflammatory Neuropathy Cause and Treatment (INCAT) disability score; EDSS, annual relapse rate; Myasthenia Score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of manifest auto-immune disease within the follow-up period(for neurological auto-immune diseases only).

secondary_outcome.description: Number of sick-leave days Number of medical visits Days of hospitalisation due to infections or due to disability or loss of function Degree of disability

arm_group.description: Any marketed SC or IV IgG can be documented

intervention.description: Not applicable. All interventions are at the discretion of the investigator. All marketed IgG formulations can be documented.

study_pop.textblock: Ambulatory or hospital-based patients (no age restriction)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects of either gender with primary, severe secondary immunodeficiency and recurrent infections or neurological autoimmune diseases
- Naïve to IgG, or pre-treated with IgG
- Subject or parent/legally authorized representative has provided written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
